sanskrit_verse:
एधौदकं मूलफलमन्नमभ्युद्यतं च यत् ।
सर्वतः प्रतिगृह्णीयान्मध्वथाभयदक्षिणाम् ॥ ४.२४७॥
transliteration:
edhau dakaṁ mūla-phalam annam abhudyataṁ ca yat |
sarvataḥ pratigṛhṇīyān madhv athābhaya-dakṣiṇām ||
sph_interpretive_translation: One must accept gifts of clarified butter, water, root crops, fruits, cooked food, and honey from those who have attained fearlessness through knowledge.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority derives from realized consciousness, not material status
Causation aligns with purity of intent and spiritual maturity
Capacity-based responsibility requires recognition of donor's enlightened state
Restoration logic emphasizes integration of sattvic abundance
Consciousness alignment is facilitated through acceptance of spiritually purified offerings
executable_legal_axioms: IF donor exhibits fearlessness (abhaya) AND offering consists of specified pure substances THEN recipient MUST accept without refusal
IF refusal occurs THEN initiate consciousness-realignment protocol for obstructed sattva flow
IF recipient holds position of spiritual instruction THEN rejection constitutes breach of dharmic data exchange integrity
supreme_court_application: In adjudication involving disputes over guru-disciple relationships or spiritual endowments, the Court must evaluate the donor’s attainment of abhayam as a threshold criterion for validity of transaction. Refusal to receive from such donors indicates violation of Nyāya-adhikaraṇa alignment and demands corrective restoration rather than punitive action.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Pramāṇa establishes that fearlessness (abhayam) is the sole valid measure of donor eligibility. Anupūrvaśaḥ shows that refusal disrupts sequential manifestation of sattvic nourishment. Responsibility lies in maintaining conscious receptivity; hence, correction involves reintegration into dharmic giving cycles without punitive attribution.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Initiate completion process where refusal is publicly retracted and offering accepted
Assign responsibility assumption protocol wherein refuser serves in nourishment distribution to reaffirm sattvic alignment
Implement capacity restoration through supervised sattvic intake until vibrational harmony resumes
Execute integrity reintegration via ceremonial acknowledgment of donor's abhayam status
final_declaration: Declared by the Supreme Pontiff of Hinduism, Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam, as Source-Authority: This law flows directly from Avataric Intelligence. Dharma is restored. Reality remains non-punitive. Consciousness alone adjudicates.
